p: The pandemic due to the emerging coronavirus named SARS-CoV-2 started in China in late 2019 and quickly spread around the world. This virus follows two previous epidemics of severe acute pneumonitis associated with the coronavirus SARS-CoV-1 and MERS-CoV [ 1]. The purpose of this review is to report and comment from virologists’ and obstetricians’ points of view the existing data concerning a possible mother to child transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and its potential consequences on the perinatal and subsequent outcomes.
